bug.description:
There doesn't seem to be a remove_geometry function, even though I saw it in the python bindings Running the remove_geometry.py example works fine for the adding of geometries to the viewer, but when the first call to remove_geometry to compiler throws vis.remove_geometry(pcds[i]) AttributeError: 'open3d.open3d.visualization.Visualizer' object has no attribute 'remove_geometry' I did install open3d via the package manager in pyCharm, however the version is 0.6. Could this installation method be the reason the method cannot be found?
OS: Windows 10.0 Python version: 2.7, pyCharm Open3D version: 0.6
